results.title: Gifts from the earth
results.creator_credit: Theodore Thomas, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Planet earth”.
There are only 150 sites world wide for the minerals essential to man and in the past decade we have been made aware that the earth is a closed system and its resources are finite. This program looks at the challenge of finding new sources of these minerals and the highly sophisticated technologies which are employed to do so, and also at how the resources are created.

results.title: Gifted kids
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor, Jennifer Torrance and Keet Neville
results.brief_description: Exceptional or gifted children represent a great potential for society, yet the majority of these children go unrecognized because public educational systems are not geared to challenge their academic, artistic and personal growth. This documentary, through interviews with teachers, parents and gifted students in Coquitlam, British Columbia, looks at one of the few school districts in North America that has continually expanding enrichment programs throughout its primary and secondary grades. The film examines how these programs stimulate the students’ particular talents, and discusses some of the problems that gifted children face in the absence of such resources.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, John Taylor, Jennifer Torrance and Keet Neville

results.title: Gifted kids
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Kay Donovan
results.brief_description: Grace and Billy Tao are Australian parents of three extremely gifted sons. Terry (14) is a Maths whiz who began university studies at age 9. His younger brother, Trevor (12), was born autistic but as a young child revealed an exceptional talent as a musician. The youngest, Nigel (10) is an all rounder but his IQ is still far higher than the national average. The Tao boys are shown at home and school and discuss how being recognised as a “gifted child” affects their lives. Includes interviews with their parents and teachers.

results.title: Gift for music
results.creator_credit: Peter Plummer and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: A visit to Chetham’s School of Music in Manchester, the first national co-educational school. Includes interviews with children who attend the school and discusses the problem of those who would like to study there but cannot. Considers the raising of school funds to educate talented children.

results.title: Gift
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Gift was shot in the Wolfen-Bitterfeld region of Germany, formerly part of the GDR. Home to intensive chemical production powered by local open-cut coalmines, Bitterfeld has been referred to as the filthiest city in Europe. Since the reunification of Germany, attempts have been made to redress the environmental damage, but the long-term effects remain evident in both the scarred landscape, and the poor health statistics of the people who live there. Gift is a mesmeric, impressionistic collage of images of industry, mining, pollution and community.

Gift is the German word for poison

results.title: Gideon's trumpet
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency and Sidney Galanty
results.brief_description: This is the story of a trial that actually took place in a quiet southeast part of the United States. The accused, Clarence Earl Gideon, a friendless drifter, launched a strange two year battle that would change the law. Based on the book by Anthony Lewis.

results.title: Gibraltar: Gateway to the Mediterranean
results.brief_description: The present political and economic situation in Gibraltar. Highlights historic events; emphasises the strategic importance ; its development as a naval base and the value of tis airstrip. Discusses the controversy with Spain. Shows familiar tourist attractions.
